meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>deviate</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to turn away</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to avert</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading.  You haven't learned this reading yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

You want <vocabulary>to turn away</vocabulary> from this movie because it's not worth watching. I mean, it isn't bad, but it isn't good. It's just <reading>so</reading>-so (そ). But that's not enough to keep your interest.
